title_sort: louisa van velsor whitman to walt whitman, 1 may [1873]
title: Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 1 May [1873]
text: 1 May 1873walter dearyour letter is come this 1 of mayMay with the money all safe i received your letter also on tuesdayTuesday i was glad to hear you was so well then but sorry to hear you dontdon't feel so well when you wrote this i want you to write just how you are whenever you write) i got a letter from Jeffy last mondayMonday i think it was he writes they are all very well indeed he is to get quite a lift from his kansasKansas work and he said it would come in very good for him i dontdon't know what his expencesexpenses is but they seem to be very well satisfied at their boarding place he said mrMr. BucklyBuckley was coming on to new yorkNew York in a short time and he would come back by the way of washingtonWashington and jeffJeff wanted me to write to you to ask if you couldentcouldn't come on to st louLou isSt. Louis with him i dontdon't suppose you could go any way so maybeemaybe walterWalter dear you had better write to Jeff i have not felt very well lately i am troubled very much lately with the dispepsydyspepsia which makes me feel pretty bad we have lived quite poor lately as they thought georgeGeorge wouldentwouldn't get the bostonBoston work but yesterday he got a letter from davisDavis giving him the work i dontdon't know as it will make any difference but i doodo feel sometimes if i could have something except the regular fare i should like it as my appetite has been not very good but i beleivebelieve people cantcan't change when they get in such ways of saving to hear the talk you would think they were very much put to it georgeGeorge has had work for mrMr. Lane he expects to get 6 dollars a day for it all and 8 a day for the new yorkNew York and he will get 5 per day for bostonBoston but mrMr. Lanes work will be done before long i beleivebelieve)i paid Lou the money for eddsEdd's board she is better is around all the time now write as often as you can dear waltWalt the papers come on tuesdayTuesday all safe you dontdon't get the graffickGraphic i suppose nowgood bie walterWalter dear Louisa Van Velsor Whitman to Walt Whitman, 1 May [1873]
